thread.title: Jarryd Stoneman announces famous ‘dancing Nan’ is retiring from Facebook: Video
thread.title_full: Jarryd Stoneman announces famous ‘dancing Nan’ is retiring from Facebook: Video

author: Debbie Schipp
title: Jarryd Stoneman announces famous ‘dancing Nan’ is retiring from Facebook: Video
text:
THE loving New Zealand grandson who shared a video of him dancing with his grandmother is tugging at our heartstrings again. 
Jarryd Stoneman, 24, melted hearts with the video he uploaded to Facebook of him dancing with his diminutive Nan, Katie Thomas, in March last year.
Ms Thomas, who can’t walk unassisted and has Alzhiemer’s disease, smiled as she danced arm-in-arm with her grandson to the Lukas Graham song 7 Years .
The video went viral, and Jarryd, who is the main carer to his grandmother, has regularly posted updates about their life and their special bond to his Facebook page ever since.
But now he’s decided to stop documenting their lives together.
In a video posted to his page, lying alongside his Nan on her bed, he said it is time for her to rest.
“We’ve made the decision it’s time for nanny to retire from Facebook fame,” Mr Stoneman said.
“I just think it’s the right time for her to just park up and get out of the public eye.”
“You’re getting tired hey, my nan?” he asks her, with a loving look.
Thanking everyone who had watched their videos and sent them messages, he said “there’s plenty more years to come”.
“You’re still doing fine, aye nanny? It’s just time for her to get off Facebook and just chill. Just chill in her chair. There’s still gonna be a lot of support out here, with my sister and mum and I’m still gonna be here for her.”
He closes the video by saying “for now it’s goodbye”, and giving his Nan a kiss on the cheek.
Of the dance video that went viral last year, Jarryd said it was originally intended just for family.
He posted it to them with the words “she can’t remember much but she still knows how to move”.
Jarryd Stoneman and Nan embrace as the dance begins. Source: Jarryd Stoneman/Facebook Source: Facebook 
Nan smiles with delight as the dance with her beloved grandson continues. Source: Jarryd Stoneman/Facebook Source: Facebook 
In it, Jarryd gently asks his nan if she would like to dance, and helps her out of her walking frame.
As she finds her feet and the dance continues, Jarryd at one point drops to his knees and she smiles into his eyes. The pair share a long hug.
“She can’t walk but she can dance,” says Jarryd, as he returns to his feet and the song continues.
“Still got it, hey Nanny.”
When the song ends, he retrieves her walking frame, kisses her gently on the head, and they head off for breakfast.
The love between the pair shines through.
